sources.name: Best Practice
sources.filter: IsClosed=false and Amount >= 50000 and Type not in ( 'Renewal New Contract','Contracted Recurring')

sources.name: Gold Standard:Large Enterprise Opportunities
sources.filter: IsClosed=false and Amount >= 50000 and Type not in ( 'Renewal New Contract','Contracted Recurring')
sources.description: Gold Standard Insights - Library of insights shipped with MAX for Opportunity Management customers.

insights.text: The insight map has not been updated in {!Days_Since_Insight_Map_Update__c} days. With the opportunity in the {!StageName} stage, you need to continually strive for a deeper understanding of the problems the customer is looking to resolve. Share your insight map with your contacts and use it to help you validate your understanding and uncover any additional issues they may have.
insights.ruleDescription: Days Since Insight Map Update >= 21 AND (Insight Map Completeness <> OK OR Insight Map Goals and Initiatives Owners <> All Key Players OR Insight Map Key Player Presence <> OK OR Insight Map Owner Awareness <> All)
insights.name: Insight: Keep working to understand what matters to the Key Players

insights.text: The relationship map has not been updated in {!Days_Since_Pol_Map_Update__c} days. With the opportunity in the {!StageName} stage, you need to strive for a deeper understanding of the people you should be working with and work towards building deep relationships with the Key Players.
insights.ruleDescription: Days_Since_Pol_Map_Update__c >= 21
insights.name: Relationships: Keep working to understand the people, build your relationships

insights.text: It looks like some of the Key Players are supporters and/or mentors - this is great news! However, you have not identified anyone as a Non-supporter or Enemy. It is unusual to have complete support at this stage. Work with those you are sure of and validate that you are correct in your assessment of who is involved in the opportunity, and where their preference lies. You want to avoid all potential blindspots so as not to have any last minute surprises.
insights.ruleDescription: Neg. Preference = None AND (Phase = Early OR Phase = Mid) AND Preference <> Key Player
insights.name: Relationship Map: Key Player support is good; no non-supporters is questionable

insights.text: The Decision Maker from the Relationship Map appears to be on your side, which is great. However, you have low access levels with them. Work to get deeper contact with them to ensure you aren't being overly optimistic, you will want confirm your assessment of their preference for you is valid.
insights.ruleDescription: Decision Maker Contact <> OK AND Decision Maker Count = 1
insights.name: Relationship Map: Preference from Decision Maker is great but must be validated

insights.text: You don't have meaningful contact with the Decision Maker. Because you are past the early stages, this is a significant risk. Map out a plan with your supporters to gain deeper access to the Decision Maker as soon as possible.
insights.ruleDescription: Phase <> Early AND Key Player Count > 0 AND Decision Maker Contact = Limited AND Decision Maker Count = 1
insights.name: Relationship Map: Limited contact with the Decision Maker

insights.text: The Decision Maker actively supports the alternative option(s). At this stage you should determine how you can win, gain their support through someone that has a direct line of influence into them or if that is not possible, whether you should bow out. Ask your supporters to help you with this decision.
insights.ruleDescription: Decision Maker Non-Support = Yes AND Decision Maker Count = 1
insights.name: Relationship Map: Decision Maker is negative towards you

insights.text: This opportunity hasn't been updated in {!DMAPP__Dealmaker_Opportunity__r.DMMAX__DaysSinceLastModification__c} days. It is still valid? You should consider closing this opportunity and taking it out of the pipeline so that you have a clear understanding of your true pipeline.
insights.ruleDescription: Days Since Last Modification > 100
insights.name: Warning: Opportunity is inactive [BEST PRACTICE - TO BE CHANGED]

insights.text: You haven't uncovered anyone on the Relationship Map that prefers you at this stage. Is this really true? Validate that your current state is reflected on the Relationship Map. If you don't have a Key Player that wins if your solution wins, the chances of winning the deal are stacked against you.
insights.ruleDescription: Phase = Mid AND Preference = None
insights.name: Relationship Map: High risk, no supporters identified

insights.text: Your assessment indicates Inside Support. However, your Relationship Map doesn't reflect any of the Key Players as Supporters or Mentors. Remember, a 'Yes' to Inside Support means that a Key Player in the opportunity is your Mentor or Supporter, therefore they win, if your solution wins. Either review the Relationship Map to accurately determine whether any of the Key Players are supporters or mentors, or adjust Inside Support to a 'No' or 'Unknown' in your Assessment.
insights.ruleDescription: TAS11 - Inside Support = Yes AND Mentor <> Key Player AND Supporter <> Key Player AND Key Player Count > 0
insights.name: Conflict: Inside Support / Relationship Map

insights.text: You have answered yes to Solution Fit in Assessment. However, you neither have a Compelling Event nor Formal Decision Criteria to understand the customer's requirements. You should reassess Solution Fit, or the other indicators, to ensure you are looking at Solution Fit from the customer's perspective.
insights.ruleDescription: TAS05 - Compelling Event <> Yes AND TAS06 - Formal Criteria <> Yes AND TAS07 - Solution Fit = Yes
insights.name: Assessment: Questionable Solution Fit

insights.text: The Decision Maker does not have an identified preference for you or an alternative option. You need to work to gain their support. Look to your supporters, those with a direct line of influence into the Decision Maker, and ask them how you can gain the support of the Decision Maker. You need to work quickly before they start to build preference for an alternative.
insights.ruleDescription: Decision Maker Non-Support <> Yes AND Decision Maker Count = 1 AND Preference <> None
insights.name: Relationship Map: Decision Maker is not on your side

insights.text: You have indicated that you have Unique Business Value in Assessment. However, itâ€™s very difficult to have UBV without Solution Fit, Formal Decision Criteria and a Compelling Event. You should reassess your Unique Business Value, or the other indicators, to ensure you are looking at UBV from the customer's perspective.
insights.ruleDescription: TAS01- Customer Project = Yes AND TAS10 - UBV = Yes AND (TAS05 - Compelling Event <> Yes OR TAS06 - Formal Criteria <> Yes OR TAS07 - Solution Fit <> Yes)
insights.name: Assessment: Questionable UBV

insights.text: This opportunity is in the {!StageName} stage, but you haven't started on the Insight Map. At this stage you should, at a minimum, know tactical Obstacles the client is trying to solve. However, knowing what Obstacles exist, isn't sufficient to win. To make sure there is a real opportunity and that you can successfully compete, you will need to understand the Pressures that are impacting the customer's Goals and driving this Initiative. Document these in the Insight Map and validate this with your contacts. If you don't have the information, move your opportunity back to an earlier stage and continue your discovery.
insights.ruleDescription: Phase <> Mid
insights.name: Insight Map: Document everything you have learned to date

insights.text: You don't have any non-supporters on your Relationship Map. If you are confident of this, then that is great news! However, there typically is someone in the decision making process that prefers something else - whether that is another solution, status quo, or another project altogether. Consider evaluating your Key Players with this in mind so that you can fully understand who might be supporting the competition or an alternative and make the appropriate adjustments on the Relationship Map to reflect the non-supporters.
insights.ruleDescription: Phase = Mid AND Preference <> None AND Neg. Preference = None
insights.name: Relationship Map: Looking for your competitors' supporters

insights.text: This opportunity is in the {!StageName} stage and has not been updated in {!DMAPP__Dealmaker_Opportunity__r.DMMAX__DaysSinceLastModification__c} days. Although it has been marked as paused, it may be worthwhile considering moving this back to a develop opportunity, or clearing it out of the pipeline.
insights.ruleDescription: Days_Since_Oppty_Updated__c > 100 AND Health__c = paused
insights.name: Warning: Paused for excessive time [BEST PRACTICE - TO BE CHANGED]

insights.text: Your assessment indicates Inside Support. However, you have no Key Players (Inner Circle, Political Structure, Decision Makers, Approvers) identified on your Relationship Map. Remember, a 'Yes' to Inside Support means that a Key Player in the opportunity is your Mentor or Supporter, therefore they win, if your solution wins. Either review the Relationship Map to identify the Key Players and accurately indicate those that are Supporters or Mentors, or adjust Inside Support to a 'No' or 'Unknown' in your Assessment.
insights.ruleDescription: TAS11 - Inside Support = Yes AND Key Player Count = 0
insights.name: Conflict: Inside Support and no Key Players identified

insights.text: The Decision Maker does not have an identified preference for you or an alternative option and you have no other supporters identified that can help you. At this stage, you need to uncover some supporters who can help you in navigating this opportunity. As soon as you have access to some supporters, you can look to them to help you gain access to, and support from, the Decision Maker.
insights.ruleDescription: Decision Maker Non-Support <> Yes AND Decision Maker Count = 1 AND Preference = None
insights.name: Relationship Map: Nobody on your side

insights.text: It has been {!DMAPP__Dealmaker_Opportunity__r.DMMAX__DaysSinceLastModification__c} days since this opportunity was updated. In the early phase, you need to be working frequently with the customer to help them determine their full requirements. Review your insight map and the decision criteria, alongside what you know about the key players to date. Use this detail to determine how to get your next meeting to retrieve missing information about the people and their problems.
insights.ruleDescription: Phase = Early
insights.name: Warning: No recent updates [BEST PRACTICE - TO BE CHANGED]

insights.text: You have indicated yes to Current Relationship in Assessment. However, from your Relationship Map it doesn't appear that the Key Players are on your side. Remember, a 'Yes' to Current Relationship means that a Key Player in the opportunity considers that you or your company will add value, based on previous experience with you.
insights.ruleDescription: TAS09 - Current Relationship = Yes AND Preference = None AND Decision Maker Support <> Yes
insights.name: Conflict: Current Relationship / Relationship Map

insights.text: It has been {!DMAPP__Dealmaker_Opportunity__r.DMMAX__DaysSinceLastModification__c} days since any updates have been made to this opportunity. Opportunities in the {!StageName} stage are usually updated more frequently. Review what's happening with this opportunity and consider what you need to do next to keep the momentum moving forward.
insights.ruleDescription: (Phase = Early AND Days Since Last Modification > 7) OR (Phase = Mid AND Days Since Last Modification > 14) OR (Phase = Late AND Days Since Last Modification > 30) OR Days Since Last Modification > 90
insights.name: Warning: No recent updates to this opportunity [BEST PRACTICE - TO BE CHANGED]

insights.text: You haven't started on the Insight Map. At this stage, it is important that you understand the Pressures that are impacting the customer's Goals and driving the Initiatives. Also, you will want to fully understand the Obstacles that the Initiatives are trying to relieve. This will help you focus on understanding what the customer is trying to accomplish before proceeding to a next step. Work to document what you know now, and use your contacts to build out the detail and confirm who owns the Goals, Pressures, Initiatives and Obstacles being faced.
insights.ruleDescription: Phase = Mid
insights.name: Insight Map: Start with building out the customer's business issues

insights.text: You have supporters on the Relationship Map, but you donâ€™t have any Key Players (Inner Circle, Political Structure, Approver, Decision Maker) on your side and you have some non-supporters identified. Time is critical. If you aren't building preference with the Key Players, your competition or your non-supporters might be ahead of you. Assess the power and influence of your non-supporters to determine any additional risk and actions necessary.
insights.ruleDescription: Phase = Mid AND Mentor <> Key Player AND Supporter <> Key Player AND Neg. Preference <> None
insights.name: Relationship Map: No Key Players on your side

insights.text: Good job on the insight map! You have identified Goals, Pressures and Initiatives. The Key Players from your Relationship Map are well represented on the Insight Map, and everyone on the Insight Map is on your Relationship Map. Some Goals and Initiatives are owned by Key Players, but not all. Work to ensure you are capturing the Key Players' business goals and update the insight map to cover their areas of concern.
insights.ruleDescription: Insight Map Goals and Initiatives Owners = Some Key Players
insights.name: Insight Map: Well built out, review Key Players

insights.text: You have indicated that you have Political Alignment in Assessment. However, you don't have the majority of the Key Players on your Relationship Map identified as supporters. You should modify your Assessment or update the contacts on your Relationship Map to reflect your current position.
insights.ruleDescription: TAS15 - Political Alignment = Yes AND Preference <> Key Player
insights.name: Conflict: Political Alignment / Relationship Map

insights.text: You have supporters on the Relationship Map, but you donâ€™t have the majority of Key Players on your side and you have some non-supporters identified. Time is critical. If you aren't building preference with the majority of the Key Players, your competition or your non-supporters might be ahead of you. Assess the power and influence of your non-supporters to determine any additional risk and actions necessary.
insights.ruleDescription: Phase = Mid AND Preference <> None AND Neg. Preference <> None AND (Supporter = Key Player OR Mentor = Key Player)
insights.name: Relationship Map: Majority of Key Players are not on your side

insights.text: It has been {!DMAPP__Dealmaker_Opportunity__r.DMMAX__DaysSinceLastModification__c} days since this opportunity was updated. In the middle phase, you should be working frequently with the customer to prove your value and help them clearly understand how you can meet their needs better than anyone else. Work to meet with the key players to understand their needs. Help them feel confident that they will be successful if they choose to work with you.
insights.ruleDescription: Phase = Mid
insights.name: Warning: No updates recently [BEST PRACTICE - TO BE CHANGED]

insights.text: You have no Decision Maker or Key Player support on the Relationship Map, and the majority of the Decision Makers are against you. Validate that your current state is reflected on the Relationship Map. If this is true, the chances of winning are stacked against you.
insights.ruleDescription: Decision Maker Non-Support = Yes AND Mentor <> Key Player AND Supporter <> Key Player AND Decision Maker Count > 1
insights.name: Relationship Map: High risk, no key supporters and Decision Makers against you

insights.text: The majority of the Decision Makers are against you. However, you have support with other Key Players. Work with these supporters and ask for help or ideas on how to bring the Decision Makers onto your team.
insights.ruleDescription: Decision Maker Non-Support = Yes AND (Mentor = Key Player OR Supporter = Key Player) AND Decision Maker Count > 1
insights.name: Relationship Map: High risk, majority of Decision Makers against you

insights.text: It's very late in the sales cycle and you have zero supporters on your Relationship Map. To win, you need at least one Key Player as a supporter. If your lack of support is true, your chances of winning are very slim and you should consider walking away. However, if you are connected to a Key Player that is a supporter or mentor, you need to update your Relationship Map to understand how you can leverage them in order to finalize your plan to win.
insights.ruleDescription: Phase = Late AND Preference = None
insights.name: Relationship Map: Late stage with no support, consider walking away

insights.text: It has been {!DMAPP__Dealmaker_Opportunity__r.DMMAX__DaysSinceLastModification__c} days since this opportunity was updated. At this final stage, you need to make sure to stay on top of this opportunity so that it doesn't slip.
insights.ruleDescription: Phase = Late
insights.name: Warning: Not updated recently [BEST PRACTICE - TO BE CHANGED]

insights.text: You have indicated yes to UBV, which means that a Key Player has confirmed that your Solution delivers business value in a way that uniquely differentiates you from the competition. UBV would be stronger if you had support from a Decision Maker and/or Approver on the Relationship Map. Verify your UBV with your Decision Maker and/or Approver to gain their support.
insights.ruleDescription: TAS10 - UBV = Yes AND Decision Maker Support <> Yes
insights.name: Assessment: UBV is stronger with Decision Maker / Approver support

insights.text: You have identified the importance of all of the criteria for each of the Key Players. Knowing what they care about most allows you to articulate high impact value statements to each Key Player. Really good work!
insights.ruleDescription: Decision Criteria Key Player Assessment = Complete
insights.name: Decision Criteria: Good assessment

insights.text: You have indicated 'Yes' to Executive Credibility in Assessment. However, from your Relationship Map it appears that you do not have meaningful contact with and/or support from the Key Players. Remember, a 'Yes' to Executive Credibility means that you or another person on the team can regularly access an Executive Key Player. Either review the Relationship Map to accurately identify the contact and support levels from the Key Players or adjust Executive Credibility to a 'No' or 'Unknown; in your Assessment.
insights.ruleDescription: TAS12 - Exec Credibility = Yes AND (Preference <> Key Player OR Key Player Contact = None)
insights.name: Conflict: Executive Credibility / Relationship Map

insights.text: You have no Decision Maker or Key Player support on the Relationship Map. Validate that your current state is reflected on the Relationship Map. If this is true, ask yourself if you can you really win this deal? In our experience, chances of winning are stacked against you.
insights.ruleDescription: Decision Maker Non-Support <> Yes AND Mentor <> Key Player AND Supporter <> Key Player
insights.name: Relationship Map: High risk, no Key Player support

insights.text: You don't have any non-supporters on your Relationship Map at this very late stage. Sometimes we have a tendency to look at an opportunity with too much optimism. Ask your supporters: "who would stand to lose if our solution won?" or "who would prefer status quo and why?".  You want to keep close tabs on your potential non-supporters so that you donâ€™t have any surprises in the end. However, if you truly donâ€™t have non-supporters, and have a strong Compelling Event, move to close your opportunity quickly.
insights.ruleDescription: Phase = Late AND Preference <> None AND Neg. Preference = None
insights.name: Relationship Map: Are you sure there are no non-supporters?

insights.text: You have identified the importance of some of the criteria for each of the Key Players. Knowing what they care about most allows you to articulate a high impact value proposition to each Key Player. Understanding the importance of all criteria for all of the Key Players will give you a really solid foundation for your conversations going forward.
insights.ruleDescription: Decision Criteria Key Player Assessment = OK
insights.name: Decision Criteria: Good completion level

insights.text: At this late stage, although you have some support, you donâ€™t have any Key Players on your side and you do have some non-supporters identified. If you havenâ€™t built preference with Key Players, your competition or your non-supporters probably have. Realistically assess your ability to win given your current support base and take the necessary actions.
insights.ruleDescription: Phase = Late AND Preference <> None AND Neg. Preference <> None AND Supporter <> Key Player AND Mentor <> Key Player
insights.name: Relationship Map: Late stage risk, no Key Players on your side

insights.text: The majority of the Decision Makers don't support you, nor do they appear to have a preference for another option. They are open to being won over. At this stage you should determine how you can win, gain their support through someone that has a direct line of influence into them or if that is not possible, whether you should bow out. Ask your supporters - in particular the Key Players - to help you with this decision.
insights.ruleDescription: Decision Maker Non-Support <> Yes AND (Mentor = Key Player OR Supporter = Key Player) AND Decision Maker Count > 1
insights.name: Relationship Map: The majority of Decision Makers don't support you

insights.text: You haven't identified owners on the goals or initiatives on your Insight Map. Determine who might own the expected goals and initiatives, work to get access to them and confirm that these are their goals and they do own the identified initiatives. It's very likely that the goal and initiative owners will have influence on the decision, so they should be identified as the Key Players on the Relationship Map.
insights.ruleDescription: Insight Map Owner Awareness <> All AND Insight Map Goals and Initiatives Owners = None
insights.name: Conflict: No owners on Insight Map

insights.text: At this late stage, although you have some Key Player support, you donâ€™t have the majority of Key Players on your side and you do have some non-supporters identified. If you havenâ€™t built preference with the majority of the Key Players, your competition or your non-supporters probably have. Realistically assess your ability to win given your current support base and take the necessary actions.
insights.ruleDescription: Phase = Late AND Preference <> None AND Neg. Preference <> None AND (Supporter = Key Player OR Mentor = Key Player)
insights.name: Relationship Map: Late stage risk, majority of Key Players not on your side

insights.text: Although the majority of contacts on your relationship map are on your side, the Key Players or Decision Makers have preference elsewhere. You need to review what you can do to change their preference or consider bowing out of the opportunity.
insights.ruleDescription: Neg. Preference = Key Player OR Decision Maker Non-Support = Yes
insights.name: Relationship Map: Majority are supporters, but key people are not on your side

insights.text: The majority of the Decision Makers from the Relationship Map appear to be on your side, which is great. However, you have low access levels with at least some of them. Work to get deeper contact with them to ensure you aren't being overly optimistic, you will want confirm your assessment of their preference for you is valid.
insights.ruleDescription: Decision Maker Contact <> OK AND Decision Maker Count > 1
insights.name: Relationship Map: Preference from Decision Makers is great but must be validated

insights.text: Your relationship map indicates that you have support from Key Players. However, your contact level with some of the Key Players is low. In order to maintain your status with these people, it would be a good idea to increase the frequency of meeting with them. This is important so that you are on top of what matters to each of the Key Players. Because of the dynamic nature of a sales cycle, you want to continue to stay close to them so that you are not blindsided.
insights.ruleDescription: Key Player Contact <> OK
insights.name: Politics: Good support with Key Players, but low contact makes it questionable

insights.text: It looks like the majority of the Key Players are supporters and/or mentors - this is great news! However, you have not identified anyone as a Non-supporter or Enemy. It is unusual to have complete support at this stage. Work with those you are sure of and validate that you are correct in your assessment of who is involved in the opportunity, and where their preference lies. You want to avoid all potential blindspots so as not to have any last minute surprises.
insights.ruleDescription: Neg. Preference = None AND (Phase = Early OR Phase = Mid) AND Preference = Key Player
insights.name: Relationship Map:Key Player preference is good;no non-supporters is questionable

insights.text: At the {!StageName} stage it's great to have a mentor working on your behalf. It's a really good position to be in this early. Nice work!
insights.ruleDescription: Mentor = Key Player
insights.name: Relationship Map: A Key Player as a mentor - great work!

insights.text: At the {!StageName} stage it's great to have a mentor working on your behalf. It's a really good position to be in this early. Well done!
insights.ruleDescription: Mentor = General
insights.name: Relationship Map: A mentor in place already - good work!

insights.text: With your indication of a yes in Political Alignment, your Assessment has identified that the Key Player that owns the Goal(s) and/or Pressure(s) is also your mentor. Nice work! Just make sure that this Key Player has confirmed that they are willing and able to influence the outcome to help you win.
insights.ruleDescription: TAS15 - Political Alignment = Yes AND Preference = Key Player
insights.name: Good evidence of Political Alignment

insights.text: Current Relationship is '{!DMAPP__Dealmaker_Opportunity__r.DMMAX__TAS11__c}' and, looking at your Relationship Map, there are key players in your favour. This is good backup evidence to have detailed in your plan. Good work!
insights.ruleDescription: TAS11 - Inside Support = Yes AND (Mentor = Key Player OR Supporter = Key Player)
insights.name: Good evidence of Inside Support

insights.text: This opportunity is at the '{!StageName}' stage, but the assessment status does not clearly identify that there is an opportunity. Although there is a Customer Project and the Customer Business status indicates that you can demonstrate how this initiative addresses the customer's Goals and Pressures, Access to Funds is '{!DMAPP__Dealmaker_Opportunity__r.DMMAX__TAS04__c}' and Compelling Event is '{!DMAPP__Dealmaker_Opportunity__r.DMMAX__TAS05__c}'. At this stage, it is important to identify where the funds are going to come from for this project and try to uncover the specific date by which the customer must act to avoid the consequence(s) of not acting to implement this project within that timeframe. Without this, you run the risk of spending time on an opportunity that will not progress and will end up rolling forward on your forecast quarter after quarter.
insights.ruleDescription: TAS01- Customer Project = Yes AND TAS02 - Customer Business = Yes AND TAS04 - Access To Funds <> Yes AND TAS05 - Compelling Event <> Yes
insights.name: Assessment: Confirm that there is an opportunity

insights.text: It's good to see you've quickly identified the competitors on this opportunity. Understanding the other options on the table from this stage will help you better understand the customer's perspective as they make their choices, and allow you to help them better understand your advantages over the alternatives.
insights.ruleDescription: Phase <> Early
insights.name: Competitor identified quickly - good work [BEST PRACTICE - TO BE CHANGED]

insights.text: It's good to see you've identified competitors on this opportunity while in the {!StageName} stage. Understanding the other options on the table from this stage will help you better understand the customer's perspective as they make their choices, and allow you to help them better understand your advantages over the alternatives.
insights.ruleDescription: Phase = Early AND Opportunity Age >= 60
insights.name: Competitors identified early in the cycle - good work [BEST PRACTICE - TBC]

insights.text: It's good to see you've identified competitors while in the {!StageName} stage and only {!DMAPP__Dealmaker_Opportunity__r.DMMAX__GEN_OpportunityAge__c} days working the opportunity. Understanding the other options on the table from this stage will help you better understand the customer's perspective as they make their choices, and allow you to help them better understand your advantages over the alternatives.
insights.ruleDescription: Phase = Early AND Opportunity Age < 60
insights.name: Competitors identified early - good work [BEST PRACTICE - TBC]

insights.text: You have not yet determined a Compelling Event but have opted for an attack strategy ({!DMAPP__Dealmaker_Opportunity__r.DMMAX__COM_Strategy__c}). An attack strategy should only be undertaken if a Compelling Event exists. Review your Insight Map to determine if the Initiative identified on the map will relieve a Pressure that has a pressing need for change by a specific date. If a compelling event does not exist yet, you can change your competitive strategy to a positioning strategy and continue with your discovery until a compelling event becomes known and confirmed.
insights.ruleDescription: TAS05 - Compelling Event = Unknown
insights.name: Conflict: Attack Strategy without a Compelling Event

insights.text: You have determined that there is no Compelling Event but have opted for an attack strategy ({!DMAPP__Dealmaker_Opportunity__r.DMMAX__COM_Strategy__c}). An attack strategy should only be undertaken if a Compelling Event exists. Review your Insight Map to determine if the Initiative identified on the map will relieve a Pressure that has a pressing need for change by a specific date. If a compelling event does not exist yet, you can change your competitive strategy to a positioning strategy and continue with your discovery until a compelling event becomes known and confirmed.
insights.ruleDescription: TAS05 - Compelling Event = No
insights.name: Conflict: Attack Strategy with no Compelling Event

insights.text: This opportunity is in the {!StageName} stage, but you haven't started on the Insight Map. Having completed the early stage, you should know the Pressures that are impacting the customerâ€™s Goals and driving the Initiatives. It is also important at this stage to understand the Obstacles that the Initiatives are trying to relieve. Document these in the Insight Map and validate this with your contacts. Make sure that you are not obtaining all of this information from a single source, ideally triangulate the information you are gathering through multiple contacts. If you don't have this information, it will be difficult to differentiate yourself. You might need to move the opportunity back to an earlier stage as you continue discovery and gather this crucial information.
insights.ruleDescription: Phase = Mid OR Phase = Late
insights.name: Insight Map: Document everything you have learned to date

insights.text: You have a high-risk situation where your Decision Maker on the Relationship Map supports you, but a majority of the remaining Key Players are Non-Supporters. It's extremely difficult to turn a non-supporter into a supporter. This is about who has the greatest power and influence over the rest. Engage your Decision Maker to collaborate with you on a plan to win. Get them to actively take a role to gain the support of the majority of the Key Players.
insights.ruleDescription: Neg. Preference = Key Player AND Decision Maker Support = Yes AND Decision Maker Count = 1
insights.name: Relationship Map: Majority of Key Players are Non-Supporters

insights.text: You haven't yet started on the Insight Map. At this stage, documenting the Pressures that are impacting the customer's Goals and driving the Initiatives will help you focus on understanding the customer's needs before proceeding. Perhaps the customer has shared with you the tactical Obstacles that the Initiative will relieve, that is a great start! Work to document what you know now, and leverage your contacts to build out what they need to do to address these obstacles at this time. Understanding the Goals and Pressures will help you understand if this is a prioritized project for them, or a nice to have.
insights.ruleDescription: Phase = Early
insights.name: Insight Map: Start with building out the customer's business issues

insights.text: Because you are early in the sales cycle, it is normal that funds have not yet been allocated. Continue to build your insight map, that will help you build the business case the client can use to get this project prioritized and approved. Getting in early to help develop the business case can provide a competitive advantage. However if you obtain confirmation that it will not be possible to obtain any Access to Funds, you should qualify out.
insights.ruleDescription: Phase = Early AND TAS01- Customer Project = Yes AND TAS03 - Financial Condition = Yes AND TAS04 - Access To Funds = No
insights.name: Assessment: No access to funds

insights.text: At this stage ({!StageName}), you should only be moving forward with opportunities where there is a clear opportunity. You currently have no assessment started to determine 'Is there an Opportunity?'. Click through to undertake the assessment and determine if there is an opportunity before spending further time working this.
insights.ruleDescription: TAS01- Customer Project = null AND TAS02 - Customer Business = null AND TAS03 - Financial Condition = null AND TAS04 - Access To Funds = null AND TAS05 - Compelling Event = null
insights.name: Assessment: Progressed opportunity with no assessment answers

insights.text: You should consider a Test and Improve given you are actively pursuing this opportunity. Before your Test and Improve session, build out your Insight Map and Relationship Map so you and your peers will have a valuable strategy discussion.
insights.ruleDescription: Key Player Count = 0 OR Decision Maker Count = 0 OR Insight Map Completeness <> OK OR Political Map Completeness < 75
insights.name: Test and Improve: Build out your plan before your Test and Improve

insights.text: In Strategy, you should analyze your competitorâ€™s strengths and weaknesses and determine the competitive strategy they may use against you. Using this analysis, you can then determine your competitive strategy and align your actions and behaviors to support your strategy to win.
insights.ruleDescription: Strategy All Competitors <> Yes AND Strategy Completeness <> 0 AND Has Competitors = Yes
insights.name: Strategy: Missing strategy for each competitor

insights.text: You should consider a Test and Improve given you are actively pursuing this opportunity. Before your Test & Improve session, validate that your Relationship Map and Insight Map reflect all that you know regarding the people and the customerâ€™s business challenges, so you and your peers will have a valuable strategy session.
insights.ruleDescription: Key Player Count > 0 AND Decision Maker Count > 0 AND Insight Map Completeness = OK AND Political Map Completeness >= 75
insights.name: Test and Improve: Verify Insight Map and Relationship Map reflect current state

insights.text: You don't have advantage in any of the Decision Criteria identified. You need to review the criteria with the Key Players to ensure you have understood what they care about, and validate that you have properly assessed your position. If you can't determine any advantage, you should bow out of this opportunity rather than pursue where you know you are not the right option for the customer.
insights.ruleDescription: Decision Criteria Differentiation <> Some Stronger
insights.name: Criteria: No advantage identified

insights.text: You have a Customer Project with a Compelling Event, Formal Decision Criteria, Solution Fit and Inside Support. You should next identify and confirm your UBV with your supporters who can help you communicate it to all of the Key Players.
insights.ruleDescription: TAS01- Customer Project = Yes AND TAS05 - Compelling Event = Yes AND TAS06 - Formal Criteria = Yes AND TAS07 - Solution Fit = Yes AND TAS10 - UBV <> Yes AND TAS11 - Inside Support = Yes
insights.name: Assessment: Develop and confirm Unique Business Value (UBV)

insights.text: The insight / relationship maps for this opportunity have not been updated recently. With the opportunity in the {!StageName} stage, you need to continually strive for a deeper understanding of the people you should be working with and the problems they are looking to solve. Click through to review the current state of your maps, update them with any new information you have and determine your next steps.
insights.ruleDescription: Phase <> Early AND (Days_Since_Insight_Map_Update__c >= 21 OR Days_Since_Pol_Map_Update__c >= 21) AND (Insight Map Completeness <> OK OR TAS15 - Political Alignment <> Yes OR Political Map Completeness <> 100)
insights.name: Risk: Low level of activity on people/problems [BEST PRACTICE - TBC]

insights.text: You have a Current Relationship and Access to Funds with a Compelling Event. You are in a great position to help the customer formally establish a high priority project. Remember that Customer Projects are defined when a project sponsored by a Key Player has been approved and human resources are assigned. Work towards that with your customer and this opportunity will move forward.
insights.ruleDescription: TAS01- Customer Project <> Yes AND TAS04 - Access To Funds = Yes AND TAS05 - Compelling Event = Yes AND TAS09 - Current Relationship = Yes
insights.name: Assessment: Help create a priority project

insights.text: The insight / political maps for this opportunity have been updated recently. With the opportunity in the {!StageName} stage, it's good to continually strive for a deeper understanding of the people you should be working with and the problems they are looking to solve. Keep up the good work!
insights.ruleDescription: Days Since Pol Map Update <= 7 OR Days Since Insight Map Update <= 7
insights.name: Recent activity on people/problems - good to see [BEST PRACTICE - TBC]

insights.text: You've selected a Flanking strategy. What are you Flanking to? You have not identified any aspect of the customer's Decision Criteria in which you're stronger.
insights.ruleDescription: Strategy = Flanking AND (Decision Criteria Differentiation = None Stronger OR Decision Criteria Differentiation = All Equal)
insights.name: Conflict: Flanking strategy and Decision Criteria

insights.text: There is always a reason that a customer can choose "no decision" or a decision that is not in your favor. This is your toughest competitor. Remember, the key to victory is not in defeating the enemy, but in defeating the enemyâ€™s strategy; therein lies their vulnerability. To win you will need a strong Compelling Event and a well executed strategy. Speak with your Supporters to identify their alternative options and/or competing priorities. If there genuinely are no competitors at this late stage, and there is a Compelling Event, you should accelerate the timeframe to close.
insights.ruleDescription: Has Competitors = No
insights.name: Strategy: No competitors identified

insights.text: You have an opportunity. You can compete. Can you win? Maybe. You are in a good position to leverage your Inside Support to build both Executive Credibility and Political Alignment based on the Compelling Event, Solution Fit, UBV and Informal Decision Criteria. This will help expedite your closing process.
insights.ruleDescription: TAS01- Customer Project = Yes AND TAS05 - Compelling Event = Yes AND TAS06 - Formal Criteria = Yes AND TAS07 - Solution Fit = Yes AND TAS10 - UBV = Yes AND TAS11 - Inside Support = Yes AND TAS12 - Exec Credibility <> Yes AND TAS14 - Informal Criteria = Yes AND TAS15 - Political Alignment <> Yes
insights.name: Assessment: Build executive credibility and political alignment

insights.text: You have contacts on your Insight Map that own Goals, Pressures, Initiatives or Obstacles but they are not included on your Relationship Map. It's very likely that contacts that own items on the Insight Map will have influence on the decision. Review your Relationship Map and ensure all those who own items on the Insight Map are also on the Relationship Map so that you have the full picture of everyone involved.
insights.ruleDescription: Insight Map Completeness <> Empty AND Insight Map Owner Awareness <> All
insights.name: Conflict: Insight Map owners not on Relationship Map

insights.text: You have started to identify the importance of the Decision Criteria for the Key Players. At this stage, you should have enough information to complete the prioritization for all of the key players, to ensure you are articulating benefits that have the greatest impact for each of them.
insights.ruleDescription: Decision Criteria Key Player Assessment <> None
insights.name: Decision Criteria: Importance for Key Players is incomplete

insights.text: Assessment indicates you are in a winning position. There is a Project with Funds, Solution Fit, UBV and Inside Support. To solidify your position, leverage your Supporters to help you achieve Political Alignment, which is to develop support with the Key Player who owns the Goals or Pressures on the Insight Map.
insights.ruleDescription: TAS01- Customer Project = Yes AND TAS04 - Access To Funds = Yes AND TAS07 - Solution Fit = Yes AND TAS10 - UBV = Yes AND TAS11 - Inside Support = Yes AND TAS15 - Political Alignment = No
insights.name: Assessment: Looks good. Next you need Political Alignment

insights.text: Your Assessment indicates Compelling Event is '{!DMAPP__Dealmaker_Opportunity__r.DMMAX__TAS05__c}'. You have been fortunate so far that the opportunity has continued to move forward but with just {!DMAPP__Dealmaker_Opportunity__r.DMMAX__GEN_DaysToClose__c} days remaining to close, you really should understand if there is a Compelling Event to avoid any last minute surprises to the time table.
insights.ruleDescription: Days To Close < 45 AND Days To Close > 0
insights.name: Assessment: Closing dates typically slip when there's no Compelling Event

insights.text: You have indicated that you do not have any inside support. Assess your relationship map key players, and their preference, to determine if you can build inside support. If you still don't have inside support, you might want to consider walking away from this opportunity as it is very hard to win an opportunity without any Inside Support.
insights.ruleDescription: TAS11 - Inside Support <> Yes AND (Phase = Mid OR Phase = Late)
insights.name: Assessment: No Inside Support in advanced stage

insights.text: You've selected a Frontal strategy. Per the Decision Criteria, you are not in a strong position in the top two decision criteria. This seems risky.
insights.ruleDescription: Decision Criteria Top Criteria Position <> Strong AND Strategy = Frontal
insights.name: Conflict: Frontal strategy and Decision Criteria

insights.text: Your position is weak on a key issue for the key players on this opportunity. You need to either help de-prioritize this issue - flank away from it, fragment the opportunity to focus on the areas that you can show obvious unique value, or determine if there is a partner you can work with that will help you provide the complete solution.
insights.ruleDescription: Decision Criteria Top Criteria Position = Risk OR Decision Criteria Top Criteria Position = High Risk
insights.name: Criteria: Weak on one of the top criteria

insights.text: You should determine your competitive strategy and align your actions and behaviors to support your strategy. Check 'use recommended strategy' to help you determine what strategy would be best to pursue. You would hate to be outsold in an opportunity you have invested both time and resources to advance.
insights.ruleDescription: (Strategy = Unknown OR Strategy = null ) AND Has Competitors = Yes
insights.name: Strategy: No competitive strategy selected

insights.text: There are no Decision Criteria prioritized for the Key Players. Identify all of the criteria and indicate which criteria are critical vs. high priority vs. low priority to ensure your solution is relevant and that you will be able to differentiate in a way that is important to the customer. Understanding this will allow you to articulate the benefits that have the greatest impact for each of the Key Players.
insights.ruleDescription: Decision Criteria Key Player Assessment = None
insights.name: Decision Criteria: Importance is unknown for all Key Players

insights.text: Less than 50% of the Key Players on your Relationship Map are owners of Goals or Initiatives on your Insight Map. To really care about the outcome of an opportunity, as Key Players will, they should own the goals and initiatives. Review your Relationship Map and ensure you have properly identified the Key Players, then review your Insight Map and ensure you have mapped out the Goals and Initiatives for those Key Players.
insights.ruleDescription: Insight Map Completeness <> Empty AND Insight Map Key Player Presence <> OK
insights.name: Conflict: Low level of Key Players as owners on Insight Map

insights.text: You have Goals or Initiatives on your Insight Map not owned by Key Players from your Relationship Map. It is important to ensure you're focusing on the issues for the key people. Review your relationship map and look at the Inner Circle, Decision Makers and Approvers. Determine what you can do to best understand their goals, pressures and initiatives and clearly identify those on your Insight Map. Review your Insight Map and determine if the owners of the Goals and Initiatives should be marked as Key Players on your Relationship Map.
insights.ruleDescription: Insight Map Completeness <> Empty AND Insight Map Goals and Initiatives Owners <> All Key Players
insights.name: Conflict: Goals / Initiatives not owned by Key Players

insights.text: You don't have advantage on the top 2 Decision Criteria. You need to ensure you have a better position on the top criteria with the Key Players, help the Key Players de-prioritize those where your position is worse than the competition and use a Flanking Strategy to move towards the criteria where you have a stronger advantage than the competition. For this to work, you will need strong Inside Support and to validate that the criteria you are Flanking towards also matter to the client. Another option is to determine if there is a partner you can work with that will turn your "worse" into "same" or "better".
insights.ruleDescription: Decision Criteria Differentiation = Some Stronger AND (Decision Criteria Top Criteria Position = OK OR Decision Criteria Top Criteria Position = Unknown)
insights.name: Criteria: At risk with the top two Decision Criteria

insights.text: You have no contacts identified on your Relationship Map. Identify the people that are involved in this opportunity and start to determine who you need to work with, and how to gain their support.
insights.ruleDescription: Political Map Count = 0 OR Political Map Count = null
insights.name: Relationship Map: No contacts identified

insights.text: You have a high-risk situation where the majority of your Decision Makers on the Relationship Map do support you, but a majority of the remaining Key Players are Non-Supporters. It's extremely difficult to turn a non-supporter into a supporter. This is about who has the greatest power and influence over the rest. Engage your Decision Makers to collaborate with you on a plan to win. Get them to actively take a role to gain the support of the majority of the Key Players.
insights.ruleDescription: Neg. Preference = Key Player AND Decision Maker Support = Yes AND Decision Maker Count > 1
insights.name: Relationship Map: Majority of Key Players are Non-Supporters

insights.text: You are well beyond the early stages with no Compelling Event and you do have a Project in your Assessment. An opportunity is always at risk for a "no decision" loss without a Compelling Event. It is essential at this stage to find out: "What is the date by which they need the pressure relieved?" and/or "What happens if they do nothing?" Using the insight map, validate the priority of this Project as compared to other projects. If the Key Players do not have a pressing need for change by a specific date, then this doesn't look like there is an opportunity right now. Remember, it is the customer that determines whether there is an opportunity or not. If the customer does not have motivation to change, there is no opportunity.
insights.ruleDescription: TAS01- Customer Project = Yes AND TAS02 - Customer Business = Yes AND TAS05 - Compelling Event = No
insights.name: Assessment: This doesnâ€™t look like a priority project

insights.text: This opportunity seems to have progressed very quickly through the pipeline. At just {!DMAPP__Dealmaker_Opportunity__r.DMMAX__GEN_OpportunityAge__c} days old it's already in the {!StageName} stage. It's great to have opportunities that move quickly, but it's equally important to ensure that you create your opportunity when it's first identified as an opportunity, so that you can work it through the process and keep a good eye on it. Be sure not to fall into the habit of creating opportunities after you've already been working them for a while!
insights.ruleDescription: (Phase = Mid AND Opportunity Age <= 10) OR (Phase = Late AND Opportunity Age <= 20)
insights.name: Process: Very quick through the pipeline [BEST PRACTICE - TO BE CHANGED]

insights.text: Nice work! This opportunity has progressed well so far, at {!DMAPP__Dealmaker_Opportunity__r.DMMAX__GEN_OpportunityAge__c} days old it's in the {!StageName} stage, which is on target for a shorter than normal sales cycle. Keep up the good work!
insights.ruleDescription: (Phase = Early AND Opportunity Age <= 20 AND Opportunity Age > 5) OR (Phase = Mid AND Opportunity Age <= 40 AND Opportunity Age > 10) OR (Phase = Late AND Opportunity Age <= 60 AND Opportunity Age > 20)
insights.name: Process: Moving well through the pipeline [BEST PRACTICE - TO BE CHANGED]

insights.text: The earlier you identify the Key Players, the more time you have to access them and build their support for you. Remember Key Players are Inner Circle, and Political Structure contacts (amongst others, Approvers and Decision Makers are always Inner Circle or Political Structure).
insights.ruleDescription: Phase = Early AND Political Map Count > 0 AND Key Player Count = 0
insights.name: Relationship Map: Identify Key Players

insights.text: Assessment indicates you have no Access to Funds in this later stage but you are sure there is a project. This could indicate that the Customer Project is not a high priority project or that the project hasn't been approved and/or human resources haven't been assigned yet. If you have moved this opportunity forward a few times in your forecast already, you should consider qualifying out or moving this to an early develop stage so that you can continue with discovery.
insights.ruleDescription: Phase <> Early AND TAS01- Customer Project = Yes AND TAS03 - Financial Condition = Yes AND TAS04 - Access To Funds = No
insights.name: Assessment: Project not a priority?

insights.text: The Decision Maker support status is unclear but you are in a good position with the Key Players. If the Key Players have influence on the Decision Maker, youâ€™ll want to leverage them to motivate the Decision Makers in your favor.
insights.ruleDescription: Preference = Key Player AND Decision Maker Support = No AND Decision Maker Non-Support = No
insights.name: Relationship Map: Decision Maker support is unclear

insights.text: The majority of the Key Players, including the Decision Makers, on the Relationship Map do support you. However, a majority of the other people are non-supporters. Verify that the non-supporters do not have a direct line of influence to any of the Key Players to avoid a surprise later.
insights.ruleDescription: Preference = Key Player AND Decision Maker Support = Yes
insights.name: Relationship Map: Verify Non-Supporters do not have influence

insights.text: This opportunity is at the '{!StageName}' stage, but Access to Funds is '{!DMAPP__Dealmaker_Opportunity__r.DMMAX__TAS04__c}'. In your next meeting with your contact, it will be important to understand who owns the funds for this project and how those funds will be allocated. If funds are available but not yet allocated, continue to develop your business case so that your Key Player contact has what s/he needs to allocate the funds. Strengthening your position on #2 Customer Business and #5 Compelling Event will help you achieve that.
insights.ruleDescription: TAS04 - Access To Funds <> Yes AND TAS05 - Compelling Event = Yes AND (TAS01- Customer Project <> null  AND TAS02 - Customer Business <> null  AND TAS04 - Access To Funds <> null  AND TAS05 - Compelling Event <> null )
insights.name: Assessment: Work to determine access to funds

insights.text: You are past the early stages and no one is identified as the Decision Maker on your Relationship Map. Work with the contacts that you have to identify who would have the ability to commit the company to a vendor or to a certain strategic direction.
insights.ruleDescription: Phase <> Early AND Key Player Count > 0 AND Decision Maker Count = 0
insights.name: Relationship Map: Identify the Decision Makers

insights.text: Assessment 1-5 - Customer Project is '{!DMAPP__Dealmaker_Opportunity__r.DMMAX__TAS01__c}', Customer Business is '{!DMAPP__Dealmaker_Opportunity__r.DMMAX__TAS02__c}', Financial Condition is '{!DMAPP__Dealmaker_Opportunity__r.DMMAX__TAS03__c}', Access to Funds is '{!DMAPP__Dealmaker_Opportunity__r.DMMAX__TAS04__c}', Compelling Event is '{!DMAPP__Dealmaker_Opportunity__r.DMMAX__TAS05__c}' - and the fact that you have no Current Relationship at this stage indicates you should consider taking this opportunity out of the pipeline or move it to an early stage develop status.
insights.ruleDescription: Phase <> Early AND TAS01- Customer Project = No AND TAS04 - Access To Funds = No AND TAS05 - Compelling Event = No AND TAS09 - Current Relationship = No
insights.name: Assessment: No real opportunity?

insights.text: This opportunity is in the {!StageName} stage. However, it is not being progressed using the sales process. Click through to the process manager and review the verifiable outcomes you need to drive for; mark those that you have completed and determine the actions you should take to validate the next step in the process. Leaning on the outlined best practices will help ensure you don't miss any steps along the way to a successful outcome.
insights.ruleDescription: Phase = null  AND Probability (%) > 0
insights.name: Process Manager: Work your opportunity through the process

insights.text: At this {!DMAPP__Dealmaker_Opportunity__r.DMMAX__GEN_Phase__c} stage of the opportunity, you should have meaningful contact with at least half of the Decision Makers you have identified on the Relationship Map. Without direct access, your opportunity is at risk. Develop a plan, using your supporters, to gain access to the Decision Makers to build preference and make them an active part of your sales team.
insights.ruleDescription: Phase <> Early AND Key Player Count > 0 AND Key Player Contact = OK AND Decision Maker Contact <> OK AND Decision Maker Count > 0
insights.name: Relationship Map: Decision Maker contact is a concern

insights.text: Your Assessment 1-15 isn't favorable and indicates you should qualify out of this opportunity. Because the customer is currently in the later stages of their buying cycle, the fact that there is no confirmed Customer Project, Funds have not been allocated, and there is no Compelling Event makes it questionable whether there really is an opportunity. Also, your assessment indicates that you do not have a Solution Fit, you do not have a UBV the customer cares about, and you don't have Inside Support or Political Alignment. If this is all true, you should qualify out now. If this is not true, re-evaluate your Assessment so that it more accurately reflects your true position.
insights.ruleDescription: Phase <> Early AND TAS01- Customer Project = No AND TAS04 - Access To Funds = No AND TAS05 - Compelling Event = No AND TAS07 - Solution Fit = No AND TAS10 - UBV = No AND TAS11 - Inside Support = No AND TAS15 - Political Alignment = No
insights.name: Assessment: Qualify out - No Opportunity, Can't Compete, Can't Win

insights.text: This opportunity is at the '{!StageName}' stage, but Customer Project is '{!DMAPP__Dealmaker_Opportunity__r.DMMAX__TAS01__c}'. Without a specific initiative confirmed by one of the Key Players, this opportunity should not have moved forward beyond the early stage. Click through to review the assessment and update, or consider moving this opportunity back to an earlier stage in the process.
insights.ruleDescription: TAS01- Customer Project <> Yes AND (TAS01- Customer Project <> null  OR TAS02 - Customer Business <> null  OR TAS04 - Access To Funds <> null  OR TAS05 - Compelling Event <> null )
insights.name: Assessment: No known Customer Project

insights.text: The majority of Decision Makers are Non-Supporters on your Relationship Map. However the other Key Players (Inner Circle, Political Structure, Approvers) do prefer you. Leverage the power and influence of your Key Player supporters to uncover why the Decision Makers are non-supporters. Then, jointly, come up with a plan to neutralize the impact of the majority of the Decision Makers not being on  your side.
insights.ruleDescription: Preference = Key Player AND Decision Maker Non-Support = Yes AND Decision Maker Count > 1
insights.name: Relationship Map: Majority of Decision Makers are Non-Supporters

insights.text: You don't have meaningful contact with the majority of the Decision Makers. Because you are past the early stages, this is a significant risk. Map out a plan with your supporters to gain access to the majority of the Decision Makers as soon as possible.
insights.ruleDescription: Phase <> Early AND Key Player Count > 0 AND Decision Maker Contact = Limited AND Decision Maker Count > 1
insights.name: Relationship Map: Contact with limited number of Decision Makers

insights.text: You have indicated that you need more Sales Resources than normal to win. Is it because the customer is outside your usual target market or because the customer wants a heavily customized solution? You should validate that the investment is worth the reward by assessing 15-20 to ensure you are using your resources where you have the largest payback.
insights.ruleDescription: Phase <> Early AND TAS01- Customer Project = Yes AND TAS08 - Resource Requirements = No AND TAS16 - Short Term Revenue <> Yes AND TAS16 - Short Term Revenue <> No AND TAS17 - Future Revenue <> Yes AND TAS17 - Future Revenue <> No AND TAS19 - Degree Of Risk <> Yes AND TAS19 - Degree Of Risk <> No AND TAS20 - Strategic Value <> Yes AND TAS20 - Strategic Value <> No
insights.name: Assessment: Sales resources are high, but is it worth it?

insights.text: This opportunity is at the '{!StageName}' stage, but Customer Business is '{!DMAPP__Dealmaker_Opportunity__r.DMMAX__TAS02__c}'. An opportunity begins to take shape when we have a clear understanding of the client's priorities and what they are trying to accomplish. Consider moving this opportunity to an earlier stage and continue your discovery process with the customer. Spend time working to understand their business, and map out their Goals, Pressures, Initiatives and Obstacles in the Insight Map.
insights.ruleDescription: TAS02 - Customer Business = Unknown
insights.name: Assessment: Review Customer Business

insights.text: The Decision Maker is a Non-Supporter on your Relationship Map. However the other Key Players (Inner Circle, Political Structure, Approvers) do prefer you. Leverage the power and influence of your Key Player supporters to uncover why the Decision Maker is a non-supporter. Then, jointly, come up with a plan to neutralize the impact of the Decision Maker not being on  your side.
insights.ruleDescription: Preference = Key Player AND Decision Maker Non-Support = Yes AND Decision Maker Count = 1
insights.name: Relationship Map: Decision Maker is a Non-Supporter

insights.text: At {!DMAPP__Dealmaker_Opportunity__r.DMMAX__GEN_OpportunityAge__c} days old, it is unusual for an active opportunity to remain in the {!StageName} stage. Click through to review this opportunity and validate that it remains a viable and active opportunity or determine whether it should be moved to 'nurture'.
insights.ruleDescription: Phase = Early AND Opportunity Age >= 90
insights.name: Warning: Aging Opportunity [BEST PRACTICE - TO BE CHANGED]

insights.text: You have determined that there is no Compelling Event but have opted for an attack strategy ({!DMAPP__Dealmaker_Opportunity__r.DMMAX__COM_Strategy__c}). An attack strategy should only be undertaken if a Compelling Event exists. Review your Insight Map to determine if the Initiative identified on the map will relieve a Pressure that has a pressing need for change by a specific date. If a compelling event does not exist yet, you can change your competitive strategy to a positioning strategy and continue with your discovery until a compelling event becomes known and confirmed.
insights.ruleDescription: (TAS05 - Compelling Event = No OR TAS05 - Compelling Event = Unknown) AND (Strategy = Frontal OR Strategy = Flanking)
insights.name: Conflict: Competitive Strategy and Compelling Event

insights.text: You have a majority of the Key Players on the Relationship Map defined as Non-Supporters and as part of that group, no clear preference across the Decision Makers. You have enough Non-Supporters with power and influence to cause great concern. Determine if this deal is really winnable before you invest further time and resources.
insights.ruleDescription: Neg. Preference = Key Player AND Decision Maker Support = No AND Decision Maker Non-Support = No
insights.name: Relationship Map: Key Players are Non-Supporters with no Decision Maker support

insights.text: You have contact with only a limited number of the Key Players. Because you are past the early stages, that makes you vulnerable in this opportunity. Map out a plan with your supporters to gain access to more of the Key Players.
insights.ruleDescription: Phase <> Early AND Key Player Count > 0 AND Key Player Contact = Limited
insights.name: Relationship Map: Contact with a limited number of Key Players

insights.text: Your Assessment indicates you need to invest more than the average amount of Sales Resources to win and Short Term Revenue is below average with no Future Revenue or Strategic Value. You may want to reevaluate whether you should keep working on this opportunity. Time you spend here, you are not spending on an opportunity of better quality. Decide wisely!
insights.ruleDescription: TAS01- Customer Project = Yes AND TAS08 - Resource Requirements = No AND TAS17 - Future Revenue = No AND TAS20 - Strategic Value = No AND (TAS07 - Solution Fit = Unknown OR TAS07 - Solution Fit = null  OR TAS10 - UBV = Unknown OR TAS10 - UBV = null  OR TAS11 - Inside Support = Unknown OR TAS11 - Inside Support = null )
insights.name: Assessment: Resources are high. Revenue potential is low.

insights.text: At {!DMAPP__Dealmaker_Opportunity__r.DMMAX__GEN_OpportunityAge__c} days old and in the '{!StageName}' stage, there is no competitor identified on this opportunity. It is very unusual for a customer not to have an alternative option considered on an opportunity of this size ({!Amount}). Work with the people you know to understand who else they might be talking to or what alternate options they may be considering. Remember status quo, and in-house solution, or an alternative project are options organizations consider.
insights.ruleDescription: (Phase = Mid OR Phase = Late OR Opportunity Age >= 60) AND Has Competitors = No
insights.name: No competitors identified [BEST PRACTICE - TO BE CHANGED]

insights.text: The majority of the Key Players, including the Decision Makers, on the Relationship Map are Non-Supporters. It's very difficult to turn a Non-Supporter into a Supporter. In this case, it appears insurmountable. If your information is correct, you should qualify out of this opportunity.
insights.ruleDescription: Neg. Preference = Key Player AND Decision Maker Non-Support = Yes
insights.name: Relationship Map: No clear path to win

insights.text: In Assessment 1-5, you clearly have an opportunity in addition to a Current Relationship, which is outstanding. However, you have indicated that the customer is not likely to succeed if you pursue the opportunity. It will be important that you come up with a plan to negate that risk. If the risk is too great, you might want to consider qualifying out so that your reputation as an organization is not negatively impacted. A few additional factors to keep in mind: Future Revenue and Profitability are lower than average and the customer doesnâ€™t represent any added Strategic Value to the company.
insights.ruleDescription: TAS01- Customer Project = Yes AND TAS02 - Customer Business = Yes AND TAS03 - Financial Condition = Yes AND TAS04 - Access To Funds = Yes AND TAS05 - Compelling Event = Yes AND TAS09 - Current Relationship = Yes AND TAS17 - Future Revenue = No AND TAS18 - Profitability = No AND TAS19 - Degree Of Risk = No AND TAS20 - Strategic Value = No
insights.name: Assessment: Highly qualified deal not worth winning?

insights.text: At this stage of the opportunity, you should have meaningful contact with at least a third of the Key Players on the Relationship Map with focus on the Decision Maker and/or Approver. Having access to Evaluator Key Players with strong influence line into Decision Maker and/or Approver is also a considerable strength. Develop a plan, using your supporters, to gain access to the most influential Key Players to build preference and make them an active part of your sales team.
insights.ruleDescription: Phase <> Early AND Key Player Count > 0 AND Key Player Contact <> OK
insights.name: Relationship Map: Key Player contact is a concern

insights.text: It's good to see you've identified competitors on this opportunity. Understanding the other options on the table from this stage will help you consider the customer's perspective as they make their choices, and allow you to support them in determining the advantage of your solutions over the alternatives.
insights.ruleDescription: (Phase = Early OR Opportunity Age < 60) AND Has Competitors = Yes
insights.name: Competitors identified - good work [BEST PRACTICE - TO BE CHANGED]

insights.text: You have not identified any Key Players on your Relationship Map and you are well past the early stages. You need to have Key Players on your side in order to win. Remember that Key Players are Inner Circle and Political Structure contacts (alongside others, Decision Makers and Approvers are always part of the Inner Circle or Political Structure).
insights.ruleDescription: Phase <> Early AND Political Map Count > 0 AND Key Player Count = 0
insights.name: Relationship Map: Urgently need to identify Key Players

insights.text: At this stage ({!StageName}), you should only be moving forward with opportunities where there is a clear opportunity. The assessment currently has: Customer Project is '{!DMAPP__Dealmaker_Opportunity__r.DMMAX__TAS01__c}', Customer Business is '{!DMAPP__Dealmaker_Opportunity__r.DMMAX__TAS02__c}', Access to Funds is '{!DMAPP__Dealmaker_Opportunity__r.DMMAX__TAS04__c}' and Compelling Event is '{!DMAPP__Dealmaker_Opportunity__r.DMMAX__TAS05__c}'. To confidently move forward, all of these questions should be set to 'yes'. Click through to review the assessment and either update or, if the status is valid, consider moving this opportunity back to an earlier stage to develop it further.
insights.ruleDescription: (Phase = Mid OR Phase = Late) AND (TAS01- Customer Project <> Yes OR TAS02 - Customer Business <> Yes OR TAS04 - Access To Funds <> Yes OR TAS05 - Compelling Event <> Yes)
insights.name: Assessment: Questionable progress with 'Is there an Opportunity'

insights.text: You havenâ€™t identified meaningful contact with any of the Key Players. Because you are past the early stages, this is a significant risk. Map out a plan with your supporters to gain access to the Key Players that can influence the Decision Maker and/or Approver.
insights.ruleDescription: Phase <> Early AND Key Player Count > 0 AND Key Player Contact = None
insights.name: Relationship Map: No contact with any Key Players

insights.text: At this stage ({!StageName}), it's good to have such a solid opportunity in play. You can confidently move forward to the next phase. Good work!
insights.ruleDescription: Phase = Early AND TAS01- Customer Project = Yes AND TAS02 - Customer Business = Yes AND TAS04 - Access To Funds = Yes AND TAS05 - Compelling Event = Yes
insights.name: Assessment: Solid progress on 'Is there an Opportunity'

insights.text: You are beyond the early stages and you haven't determined if this is a high quality deal in your Assessment. By assessing your position on the opportunity, alongside that of your competition, you will be better able to determine the appropriate next steps to move forward.
insights.ruleDescription: Phase <> Early AND Assessment Completeness = 0
insights.name: Assessment: Missing

insights.text: There are inconsistencies in your Assessment indicators 1-10 that could mislead you in determining the true quality of your opportunity. Click through to review the Assessment concerns and make the appropriate changes.
insights.ruleDescription: (TAS05 - Compelling Event <> Yes AND TAS06 - Formal Criteria <> Yes AND TAS07 - Solution Fit = Yes) OR (TAS01- Customer Project = Yes AND TAS10 - UBV = Yes AND (TAS05 - Compelling Event <> Yes OR TAS06 - Formal Criteria <> Yes OR TAS07 - Solution Fit <> Yes))
insights.name: Assessment: Answers are inconsistent within indicators 1-10

insights.text: Knowing that there is a Customer Project in your Assessment is not enough to know if you have a qualified opportunity. Assess the remaining indicators to ensure you understand the Compelling Event and they have Access to Funds, at a bare minimum.
insights.ruleDescription: Phase = Early AND TAS01- Customer Project = Yes AND TAS02 - Customer Business <> Yes AND TAS02 - Customer Business <> No AND TAS03 - Financial Condition <> Yes AND TAS03 - Financial Condition <> No AND TAS04 - Access To Funds <> Yes AND TAS04 - Access To Funds <> No AND TAS05 - Compelling Event <> Yes AND TAS05 - Compelling Event <> No
insights.name: Assessment: Complete your Assessment for 'Is there an Opportunity?'

insights.text: You have vulnerabilities in your Assessment indicators 1-20. Click through to review the Assessment concerns and take the appropriate next actions.
insights.ruleDescription: (TAS01- Customer Project = Yes AND TAS02 - Customer Business = No AND (TAS07 - Solution Fit <> Yes OR TAS08 - Resource Requirements <> Yes OR TAS19 - Degree Of Risk <> Yes OR TAS20 - Strategic Value <> Yes)) OR (TAS01- Customer Project = Yes AND TAS08 - Resource Requirements = No AND TAS17 - Future Revenue = No AND TAS20 - Strategic Value = No AND (TAS07 - Solution Fit = Unknown AND TAS07 - Solution Fit = null  AND TAS10 - UBV = Unknown AND TAS10 - UBV = null  AND TAS11 - Inside Support = Unknown AND TAS11 - Inside Support = null )) OR (TAS01- Customer Project = Yes AND TAS03 - Financial Condition = Yes AND TAS04 - Access To Funds = No) OR (TAS01- Customer Project = Yes AND TAS02 - Customer Business = Yes AND TAS03 - Financial Condition = Yes AND TAS04 - Access To Funds = Yes AND TAS05 - Compelling Event = Yes AND TAS09 - Current Relationship = Yes AND TAS17 - Future Revenue = No AND TAS18 - Profitability = No AND TAS19 - Degree Of Risk = No AND TAS20 - Strategic Value = No) OR (Phase <> Early AND TAS01- Customer Project = Yes AND TAS08 - Resource Requirements = No AND TAS16 - Short Term Revenue <> Yes AND TAS16 - Short Term Revenue <> No AND TAS17 - Future Revenue <> Yes AND TAS17 - Future Revenue <> No AND TAS19 - Degree Of Risk <> Yes AND TAS19 - Degree Of Risk <> No AND TAS20 - Strategic Value <> Yes AND TAS20 - Strategic Value <> No) OR (Phase <> Early AND TAS01- Customer Project = No AND TAS04 - Access To Funds = No AND TAS05 - Compelling Event = No AND TAS07 - Solution Fit = No AND TAS10 - UBV = No AND TAS11 - Inside Support = No AND TAS15 - Political Alignment = No) OR (Phase <> Early AND TAS01- Customer Project = No AND TAS04 - Access To Funds = No AND TAS05 - Compelling Event = No AND TAS09 - Current Relationship = No)
insights.name: Assessment: Maintain Rigorous Qualification

insights.text: Customer Project is '{!DMAPP__Dealmaker_Opportunity__r.DMMAX__TAS01__c}', Customer Business is '{!DMAPP__Dealmaker_Opportunity__r.DMMAX__TAS02__c}', Compelling Event is '{!DMAPP__Dealmaker_Opportunity__r.DMMAX__TAS05__c}', Current Relationship is '{!DMAPP__Dealmaker_Opportunity__r.DMMAX__TAS09__c}'. These are key indicators in your assessment. Early qualification is critical to maximizing the investment of time and resources. Take a look at your Assessment, focusing specifically on these key indicators, and determine what you need to do, or find out, in order to have a high quality opportunity.
insights.ruleDescription: Phase = Early AND TAS01- Customer Project <> Yes AND TAS01- Customer Project <> No AND TAS02 - Customer Business <> Yes AND TAS02 - Customer Business <> No AND TAS05 - Compelling Event <> Yes AND TAS05 - Compelling Event <> No AND TAS09 - Current Relationship <> Yes AND TAS09 - Current Relationship <> No
insights.name: Assessment: Do you have a qualified opportunity?

insights.text: You do not have a Compelling Event in your Assessment and you are well beyond the early stages. An opportunity that only possesses a compelling reason to buy and not a true compelling event, is always at risk for a â€œno decisionï¿½? loss. It is essential at this stage to find out: "What is the date by which they need the pressure relieved?" and/or "What happens if they do nothing?" If the answer is not compelling, this might not be an opportunity you want to commit in your forecast at this moment. However, if you have rolled this opportunity forward more than 3 times already, you should qualify it out. Remember, it is important to assess the customers' motivation for change and their timing for doing so. Opportunities that do not possess a Compelling Event typically are not urgent or a priority for the customer, hence the reason the customer is not moving forward with you at this stage.
insights.ruleDescription: TAS05 - Compelling Event <> Yes AND (Phase = Mid OR Phase = Late) AND Assessment Completeness > 0
insights.name: Assessment: No Compelling Event at this stage?

insights.text: Inside Support is '{!DMAPP__Dealmaker_Opportunity__r.DMMAX__TAS11__c}', Political Alignment is '{!DMAPP__Dealmaker_Opportunity__r.DMMAX__TAS15__c}' and Executive Credibility is '{!DMAPP__Dealmaker_Opportunity__r.DMMAX__TAS12__c}'. These are three of five key indicators of 'Can You Win'. At this stage in the opportunity, you need to strive for all of these to be 'Yes'. You need to identify and focus on the key buyers now.
insights.ruleDescription: (Phase = Mid OR Phase = Late) AND (TAS12 - Exec Credibility = No OR TAS11 - Inside Support <> Yes OR TAS15 - Political Alignment = No) AND Assessment Completeness > 0
insights.name: Assessment: Trouble with 'Can We Win'

insights.text: According to your Assessment, you are in a highly qualified opportunity. Click through to review next steps to maintain your momentum.
insights.ruleDescription: (TAS01- Customer Project <> Yes AND TAS04 - Access To Funds = Yes AND TAS05 - Compelling Event = Yes AND TAS09 - Current Relationship = Yes) OR (TAS01- Customer Project = Yes AND TAS05 - Compelling Event = Yes AND TAS06 - Formal Criteria = Yes AND TAS07 - Solution Fit = Yes AND TAS10 - UBV <> Yes AND TAS11 - Inside Support = Yes)
insights.name: Assessment: Looks like a highly qualified opportunity

insights.text: This is a highly qualified opportunity. Make sure to evaluate if it's worth winning 16-20 in Assessment to ensure the risk is worth the reward as compared to other opportunities in your pipeline.
insights.ruleDescription: Phase = Early AND TAS01- Customer Project = Yes AND TAS02 - Customer Business = Yes AND TAS03 - Financial Condition = Yes AND TAS04 - Access To Funds = Yes AND TAS05 - Compelling Event = Yes AND TAS09 - Current Relationship = Yes AND TAS16 - Short Term Revenue <> Yes AND TAS16 - Short Term Revenue <> No AND TAS17 - Future Revenue <> Yes AND TAS17 - Future Revenue <> No AND TAS18 - Profitability <> Yes AND TAS18 - Profitability <> No AND TAS19 - Degree Of Risk <> Yes AND TAS19 - Degree Of Risk <> No
insights.name: Assessment: Well qualified opportunity

insights.text: Your Assessment indicates you are in a position to win this opportunity. You have favorable status with indicators Customer Project, Access to Funds, Compelling Event, Solution Fit, UBV, Inside Support and Political Alignment. You should move to close this opportunity before your competitors have a chance to change your winning position.
insights.ruleDescription: TAS01- Customer Project = Yes AND TAS04 - Access To Funds = Yes AND TAS05 - Compelling Event = Yes AND TAS07 - Solution Fit = Yes AND TAS10 - UBV = Yes AND TAS11 - Inside Support = Yes AND TAS15 - Political Alignment = Yes
insights.name: Assessment: Move to close this opportunity

insights.text: The information in your Assessment is inconsistent with your Relationship Map. Click to view the inconsistencies and make the appropriate adjustments to have a clear view of your current position.
insights.ruleDescription: (TAS11 - Inside Support = Yes AND Mentor <> Key Player AND Supporter <> Key Player) OR (TAS09 - Current Relationship = Yes AND Preference = None) OR (TAS15 - Political Alignment = Yes AND Mentor <> Key Player) OR (TAS10 - UBV = Yes AND Decision Maker Support <> Yes) OR (TAS12 - Exec Credibility = Yes AND (Key Player Contact = None OR Preference <> Key Player))
insights.name: Conflict: Assessment / Relationship Map

insights.text: The information in your Assessment is evidenced in your Relationship Map. Keeping this level of consistency in your opportunity plan gives you, and everyone that's working with you, a clear understanding of your current position. Nice work!
insights.ruleDescription: (TAS11 - Inside Support = Yes AND (Mentor = Key Player OR Supporter = Key Player)) OR (TAS15 - Political Alignment = Yes AND Preference = Key Player)
insights.name: In Synch: Assessment & Relationship Map
