insights.text: You haven't recorded the Decision Criteria for each of the Key Players, however, your assessment is 'Yes' for at least one of Formal Decision Criteria, Solution Fit or Informal Decision Criteria. This is a mismatch. You should document the Decision Criteria for each of the Key Players and understand the priority to ensure you do have Solution Fit, Formal and Informal Decision Criteria.
insights.ruleDescription: Decision Criteria Key Player Assessment <> Complete AND (TAS06 - Formal Criteria = Yes OR TAS07 - Solution Fit = Yes OR TAS14 - Informal Criteria = Yes)
insights.name: Conflict: Assessment / Decision Criteria / Solution Fit

insights.text: You have fully documented and prioritized the Decision Criteria for each of the Key Players, allowing you to validly set your assessment as 'Yes' for at least one of Formal Decision Criteria, Solution Fit or Informal Decision Criteria. Great work in getting this information detailed out on your opportunity!
insights.ruleDescription: Decision Criteria Key Player Assessment = Complete AND (TAS06 - Formal Criteria = Yes OR TAS07 - Solution Fit = Yes OR TAS14 - Informal Criteria = Yes)
insights.name: In Synch: Assessment / Decision Criteria / Solution Fit

insights.text: You need a clear picture of the Key Players and how to gain access to them. Click through to the Relationship Map to update or build your plan to identify and gain access to the Key Players.
insights.ruleDescription: (Opportunity Age >= 7 AND Political Map Count = 0) OR (Phase = Early AND Opportunity Age >= 7 AND Key Player Count = 0) OR (Phase = Mid AND Decision Maker Contact = None) OR (Phase = Late AND Decision Maker Contact <> OK)
insights.name: Relationship Map: Build access to Key Players [BEST PRACTICE - TO BE CHANGED]

insights.text: In the {!StageName} stage, you already have a mentor - someone that wants your solution to win and is working on your behalf to help you win. This is great - nice work! Make sure you understand what they win if your solution wins, the answer to that will be connected to the Unique Business Value they perceive of your solution.
insights.ruleDescription: (Mentor = General OR Mentor = Key Player) AND Phase = Early
insights.name: Relationship Map: Great to have a mentor early in the process!

insights.text: The number of buyers on the Relationship Map seems unusually high for this opportunity. Are all these people involved in the decision? If so, spend your time with the Key Players to build Inside Support and Political Alignment as opposed to spending time with those that are less critical in the decision making process.
insights.ruleDescription: Political Map Count > 20
insights.name: Relationship Map: The number of buyers seems unusually high

insights.text: Your Relationship Map indicates you are not preferred by the Key Players. Click through to see actions you should consider.
insights.ruleDescription: Political Map Count > 0 AND (Phase = Mid OR Phase = Late) AND (Preference <> Key Player OR (Supporter <> Key Player AND Mentor <> Key Player))
insights.name: Relationship Map: Key Player problem

insights.text: Your Relationship Map indicates you are preferred by Key Players. It's great to have Key Players on your side.
insights.ruleDescription: Political Map Count > 3 AND (Preference = Key Player OR Supporter = Key Player OR Mentor = Key Player)
insights.name: Relationship Map: Preference with Key Players - that's great!

insights.text: You don't have the Decision Makers from the Relationship Map on your side. Click though to see the details of your Decision Maker status. You need to gain access to these contacts and start to build their trust and belief in your solution.
insights.ruleDescription: (Decision Maker Support <> Yes) AND (Phase = Mid OR Phase = Late) AND Decision Maker Count > 0
insights.name: Relationship Map: Decision Makers are not on your side

insights.text: Good work - the Decision Makers from the Relationship Map are on your side. Having access to these contacts and working to build their trust and belief in your solution puts you in a great position to progress and ultimately win this opportunity.
insights.ruleDescription: Decision Maker Support = Yes
insights.name: Relationship Map: Majority of Decision Makers on your side

insights.text: The majority of people, or Key Players, on your Relationship Map are Non-Supporters. This represents a significant risk to winning. Click through to see the details.
insights.ruleDescription: Neg. Preference = Key Player OR Neg. Preference = General
insights.name: Relationship Map: Majority of people are Non-Supporters

insights.text: The majority of people on your Relationship Map are Supporters. That's a great start! You can now work to use those contacts to get preference with the majority of the Key Players.
insights.ruleDescription: Preference = General
insights.name: Relationship Map: Majority of contacts are Supporters

insights.text: You have prioritized the decision criteria for the Key Players involved in the decision making process. However, you do not have meaningful contact with a significant portion of these Key Players. To confirm that you fully understand the priorities for each of them, the best thing would be to talk to them directly to validate this information. Leverage a Supporter or Mentor to help you get in front of them in order to have the opportunity to directly ask them what matters to them and what their order of priorities are. If getting in front of them is not possible, then work with a Supporter or Mentor to help you gather this information.
insights.ruleDescription: Decision Criteria Key Player Assessment = Complete AND Key Player Contact <> OK
insights.name: Questionable: Decision Criteria prioritized for Key Players with low contact

insights.text: You haven't indicated the importance of the criteria for each of the Key Players. Knowing what they care about most allows you to articulate a high impact value proposition to each Key Player. Click through to see the details.
insights.ruleDescription: Decision Criteria Key Player Assessment <> Complete AND (Phase = Mid OR Phase = Late)
insights.name: Decision Criteria: Importance needed by Key Player

insights.text: You have identified the importance of the criteria for each of the Key Players. Knowing what they care about most allows you to articulate a high impact value proposition to each Key Player. Good work!
insights.ruleDescription: (Decision Criteria Key Player Assessment = Complete OR Decision Criteria Key Player Assessment = OK) AND Key Player Count >= 0 AND Decision Criteria Count >= 0
insights.name: Decision Criteria: Good level of completion

insights.text: There is a mismatch between the key people on the Relationship Map and the business issue (goals and initiatives) owners on the Insight Map. The Insight Map should record business issues for all the key players on the Relationship Map, and all of the owners of business issues on the Insight Map should be on the Relationship Map. Mapping the people and the problems is critical to understanding the opportunity.
insights.ruleDescription: Political Map Count > 0 AND (Insight Map Goals and Initiatives Owners <> All Key Players OR Insight Map Key Player Presence <> OK OR Insight Map Owner Awareness <> All) AND Insight Map Completeness <> Empty
insights.name: Conflict: Mismatch between people on Relationship Map and Insight Map

insights.text: Your Insight Map is empty. Building out the Insight Map to illustrate to the customer that you understand their business, builds your credibility and allows you to offer a point of view that the customer will understand is of value to them. It's ok to not complete it perfectly in one sitting, the best practice is to build your map iteratively over time. As you uncover information, place it on your map and any gaps you see will inform the next steps you should be covering in your future meetings with the customer. Click through to map out what you've uncovered about the customer's business issues to date.
insights.ruleDescription: Insight Map Completeness = Empty AND Political Map Count > 0 AND Opportunity Age > 20
insights.name: Insight Map: What is the customer's business challenge

insights.text: You don't have the customer's business challenge outlined and confirmed on the Insight Map. It's important to know the Pressures that are driving the customer's Goals and Initiatives to understand if there is a compelling reason to buy. It's also important to understand the obstacles that the Initiatives are trying to relieve. Only then do you know if your solution can potentially provide customer value. Click through to start building out your insight map.
insights.ruleDescription: (Phase <> Early OR Opportunity Age >= 30) AND Political Map Count > 0 AND Insight Map Completeness <> OK
insights.name: Insight Map: Unclear on business challenge or compelling reason to buy

insights.text: At the {!StageName} stage, you should have started an insight map. Click through to map out what you've uncovered about the customer's business issues to date.
insights.ruleDescription: Insight Map Completeness = Empty AND Political Map Count > 0 AND Phase <> Early
insights.name: Insight Map: Time it was built out

insights.text: Good job on the insight map! You have identified goals, pressures and initiatives. Goals and initiatives are owned by Key Players. The Key Players from your Relationship Map are well represented on the Insight Map, and everyone on the Insight Map is on your Relationship Map.
insights.ruleDescription: Insight Map Completeness = OK AND Political Map Count > 0 AND (Insight Map Goals and Initiatives Owners = All Key Players OR Insight Map Goals and Initiatives Owners = Some Key Players) AND Insight Map Key Player Presence = OK AND Insight Map Owner Awareness = All
insights.name: Insight Map: Built out well

insights.text: You don't have a clear advantage on the customer's Decision Criteria, which will work against you in this opportunity. Click through to see where your need to strengthen your position.
insights.ruleDescription: (Decision Criteria Key Player Assessment = OK OR Decision Criteria Key Player Assessment = Complete) AND Decision Criteria Count > 0 AND Decision Criteria Top Criteria Position <> Strong
insights.name: Criteria: Evaluate your competitive position with decision criteria

insights.text: You have a clear advantage on the customer's Decision Criteria, which will work well for you in this opportunity. You can move forward feeling strong about your solution based on the criteria identified.
insights.ruleDescription: (Decision Criteria Key Player Assessment = OK OR Decision Criteria Key Player Assessment = Complete) AND Decision Criteria Count > 0 AND Decision Criteria Top Criteria Position = Strong
insights.name: Criteria: Solid competitive position with decision criteria

insights.text: The competitive strategy you have identified to pursue appears to be at odds with the Key Player's priorities in the Decision Criteria. Assess your Strategy and the Decision Criteria and validate that you're comfortable with your decisions moving forward.
insights.ruleDescription: (Strategy = Frontal AND (Decision Criteria Top Criteria Position = Risk OR Decision Criteria Top Criteria Position = High Risk)) OR (Strategy = Flanking AND (Decision Criteria Differentiation = None Stronger OR Decision Criteria Differentiation = All Equal) AND Decision Criteria Quantity > 0)
insights.name: Conflict: Competitive Strategy and Decision Criteria

insights.text: You have identified to pursue a {!DMAPP__Dealmaker_Opportunity__r.DMMAX__COM_Strategy__c} strategy. This appears to be in-line with the Key Player's priorities in the Decision Criteria. Good work.
insights.ruleDescription: (Strategy = Frontal AND Decision Criteria Top Criteria Position = Strong AND Decision Criteria Quantity > 0) OR (Strategy = Flanking AND Decision Criteria Differentiation = Some Stronger AND Decision Criteria Count > 0)
insights.name: Strategy: Good Strategy based on Decision Criteria status

insights.text: It looks like you need to work out your competitive strategy information. Understanding your competitive strategy drives winning behavior in your opportunity. Click through to see what actions you can take.
insights.ruleDescription: (Phase = Mid OR Phase = Late) AND (Has Competitors = No OR Strategy = null  OR Strategy = Unknown OR Strategy All Competitors <> Yes)
insights.name: Strategy: Determine your Competitive Strategy

insights.text: It looks like you have determined your competitive strategy and have identified the likely strategy for each of your competitors. Understanding your competitive strategy drives winning behavior in your opportunity. Good work!
insights.ruleDescription: Has Competitors = Yes AND Strategy <> Unknown AND Strategy <> null AND Strategy All Competitors = Yes
insights.name: Strategy: Competitive Strategy identified. Good work

insights.text: You have actions overdue on this opportunity. Review your planned actions and work to complete what you had planned, re-evaluate your plans or change the dates by which the actions will be completed.
insights.ruleDescription: PRIME Overdue = Yes
insights.name: Actions: Overdue

insights.text: You have PRIME actions identified and scheduled. Identifying and actioning what you need to do next to ensure that you move this opportunity forward is great work.
insights.ruleDescription: PRIME Overdue = No AND (Tasks P >= 1 OR Tasks R >= 1 OR Tasks I >= 1 OR Tasks M >= 1 OR Tasks E >= 1)
insights.name: PRIME: Clear scheduled actions

insights.text: You don't have any PRIME actions scheduled. What do you need to do next to ensure that you move this opportunity forward? You should have actions to "Prove your value", "Retrieve missing information", "Insulate against the competition", "Minimize your weakness" and/or "Emphasize your strengths".
insights.ruleDescription: Opportunity Age >= 7 AND PRIME Completeness = 0
insights.name: PRIME: Missing [BEST PRACTICE - TBC]

insights.text: You should consider a Test and Improve given you are actively pursuing this opportunity. Proactive testing of your strategy builds confidence and ensures you have the right resources in place to win. Click through to see where you might want to focus.
insights.ruleDescription: Test & Improve Status = None AND (Phase = Mid OR Phase = Late)
insights.name: Test and Improve: Consider scheduling a Test and Improve

insights.text: Overdue Test & Improve. Statistics have proven these sessions have a significant impact on the likelihood of winning. Click through to reschedule as soon as possible, and work to win this opportunity.
insights.ruleDescription: Test & Improve Status = Overdue
insights.name: Test & Improve: Overdue!

insights.text: You have a Test & Improve session scheduled. Statistics have proven these sessions have a significant impact on the likelihood of winning, so good work in getting one scheduled! Make sure that you're ready to conduct the session with your peers, and have your vulnerabilities identified early. Getting your peers input is really valuable, and clearly articulating what you know up-front will help in the process.
insights.ruleDescription: Test & Improve Status = Scheduled
insights.name: Test & Improve: Are you ready?

a2d360000007FRcAAM.label: Opportunity Age
a2d360000007FRcAAM.description: Number of days since the opportunity was created

a2d360000007FRcAAM.label: Days To Close
a2d360000007FRcAAM.description: Number of days between today and the opportunity close date

a2d360000007FRcAAM.label: Phase
a2d360000007FRcAAM.description: Opportunity phase - Early, Mid or Late in the Sales Cycle.

a2d360000007FRcAAM.label: Decision Criteria Top Criteria Position
a2d360000007FRcAAM.description: Degree to which we are in a superior position on the most important 2 decision criteria. Strong if superior on both, OK if superior on one and neutral on the other.

a2d360000007FRcAAM.label: Contact Level - General Contact
a2d360000007FRcAAM.description: None = No contacts with meaningful (multiple or in-depth) coverage (or no contacts), Limited = 50% or less contacts with meaningful coverage, OK = More than 50% of contacts with meaningful coverage

a2d360000007FRcAAM.label: Decision Criteria Key Player Assessment
a2d360000007FRcAAM.description: Degree to which we have understood the relative priority of decision criteria for the Key Players. OK if at least one criterion per Key Player prioritized.

a2d360000007FRcAAM.label: Days since last Test & Improve
a2d360000007FRcAAM.description: The number of days since the most recent completed T&I.

a2d360000007FRcAAM.label: Days To Test & Improve
a2d360000007FRcAAM.description: The number of days between today and the next T&I scheduled. We want to check for things like a T&I is scheduled for no more than 10 days after the opportunity moves into a specific stage. This should be null if there is no T&I scheduled into the future.

a2d360000007FRcAAM.label: Decision Maker Contact
a2d360000007FRcAAM.description: OK if you have meaningful contact with 50%+ of the Decision Makers and Limited if you have meaningful contact with less than 50% of the Decision Makers

a2d360000007FRcAAM.label: Decision Maker Non-Support
a2d360000007FRcAAM.description: Majority of Decision Makers have a negative preference for you (as opposed to no preference or positive preference)

a2d360000007FRcAAM.label: Decision Maker Support
a2d360000007FRcAAM.description: Majority of Decision Makers have a preference for you (as opposed to no preference or negative preference)

a2d360000007FRcAAM.label: Insight Map Completeness
a2d360000007FRcAAM.description: OK if 1 goal, 1 pressure, 1 initiative and 1 obstacle confirmed and 33% of Goals and Initiatives (total) are Key Players. Otherwise Low if not completely Empty.

a2d360000007FRcAAM.label: Insight Map Key Player Presence
a2d360000007FRcAAM.description: OK if more than 50% of Key Players are tied to goals and initiatives on the Insight Map. Low if less than 50% but more than 0 Key Players own goals and initiatives.

a2d360000007FRcAAM.label: Mentor
a2d360000007FRcAAM.description: Key Player if a Key Player on the Relationship Map is your Mentor. Otherwise General if a non Key Player is your Mentor.

a2d360000007FRcAAM.label: Neg. Preference
a2d360000007FRcAAM.description: Key Player if the majority of Key Players have a negative preference for you. General if the majority of contacts on the Relationship Map have a negative preference. Some if 1 or more contacts have a negative preference.

a2d360000007FRcAAM.label: Key Player Contact
a2d360000007FRcAAM.description: OK if you have meaningful contact with 33%+ of the Key Players or Limited if you have meaningful contact with any of the Key Players

a2d360000007FRcAAM.label: Strategy
a2d360000007FRcAAM.description: Chosen competitive strategy

a2d360000007FRcAAM.label: Has Competitors
a2d360000007FRcAAM.description: Yes if there are competitors for the Opportunity.

a2d360000007FRcAAM.label: Enemy
a2d360000007FRcAAM.description: Key Player if a Key Player on the Relationship Map is an enemy. Otherwise General if a non Key Player contact on the Relationship Map is an enemy.

a2d360000007FRcAAM.label: Supporter
a2d360000007FRcAAM.description: Key Player if a Key Player on the Relationship Map is a Supporter. Otherwise General if a non Key Player is your Supporter.

a2d360000007FRcAAM.label: Non Supporter
a2d360000007FRcAAM.description: Key Player if a Key Player on the Relationship Map is a Non Supporter. Otherwise General if a non Key Player is a Non Supporter.

a2d360000007FRcAAM.label: Strategy All Competitors
a2d360000007FRcAAM.description: Yes if you have identified the likely competitive strategy for each of the competitors in the Opportunity.

a2d360000007FRcAAM.label: Preference
a2d360000007FRcAAM.description: Key Player if the majority of Key Players prefer you. General if the majority of contacts on the Relationship Map prefer you. Some if 1 or more contacts prefer you.

a2d360000007FRcAAM.label: Decision Criteria Differentiation
a2d360000007FRcAAM.description: Degree to which we are in a superior position on the aggregated decision criteria of the stakeholders. All Stronger if we are superior on all. All Equal if we are equal on all. Some Stronger if we are stronger on some.

a2d360000007FRcAAM.label: Decision Criteria Quantity
a2d360000007FRcAAM.description: Buckets the number of decision criteria into None, Low (1-3), Medium (4-7) or High (8+)

a2d360000007FRcAAM.label: Tasks P
a2d360000007FRcAAM.description: Number open "Prove your value" tasks

a2d360000007FRcAAM.label: Tasks R
a2d360000007FRcAAM.description: Number of open "Retrieve missing information" tasks

a2d360000007FRcAAM.label: Tasks I
a2d360000007FRcAAM.description: Number open "Insulate against competition" tasks

a2d360000007FRcAAM.label: Tasks M
a2d360000007FRcAAM.description: Number open "Minimize Weakness" tasks

a2d360000007FRcAAM.label: Tasks E
a2d360000007FRcAAM.description: Number open "Emphasize Strength" tasks

a2d360000007FRcAAM.label: TAS01- Customer Project
a2d360000007FRcAAM.description: Yes: An initiative with resources assigned by a key player has been confirmed.

a2d360000007FRcAAM.label: TAS02 - Customer Business
a2d360000007FRcAAM.description: Yes: The customer is in your sweet spot or target market.

a2d360000007FRcAAM.label: TAS03 - Financial Condition
a2d360000007FRcAAM.description: Yes: Financial information is compatible with the Customer Project.

a2d360000007FRcAAM.label: TAS04 - Access To Funds
a2d360000007FRcAAM.description: Yes: Funds for the project are approved or can be obtained.

a2d360000007FRcAAM.label: TAS05 - Compelling Event
a2d360000007FRcAAM.description: Yes: Compelling business issues, causing the Key Player(s) to act by a defined date, are well known.

a2d360000007FRcAAM.label: TAS06 - Formal Criteria
a2d360000007FRcAAM.description: Yes: Criteria are documented, well understood and attached to the key players.

a2d360000007FRcAAM.label: TAS07 - Solution Fit
a2d360000007FRcAAM.description: Yes: Your solution effectively addresses 100% of the customer's "must have" requirements.

a2d360000007FRcAAM.label: TAS08 - Resource Requirements
a2d360000007FRcAAM.description: Yes: Resources are low to normal for an opportunity of this size.

a2d360000007FRcAAM.label: TAS09 - Current Relationship
a2d360000007FRcAAM.description: Yes: A key player in the opportunity considers that you or your company will add value, based on previous experience.

a2d360000007FRcAAM.label: TAS10 - UBV
a2d360000007FRcAAM.description: Yes: From the customer's perspective, you have unique capabilities that map to the customer's "must haves".

a2d360000007FRcAAM.label: TAS11 - Inside Support
a2d360000007FRcAAM.description: Yes: You have more Supporters and Mentors than Non-supporters and Enemies.

a2d360000007FRcAAM.label: TAS12 - Exec Credibility
a2d360000007FRcAAM.description: Yes: You or another person on the team can regularly access an Executive Key Player.

a2d360000007FRcAAM.label: TAS13 - Cultural Compatibility
a2d360000007FRcAAM.description: Yes: The customer's culture is similar to yours.

a2d360000007FRcAAM.label: TAS14 - Informal Criteria
a2d360000007FRcAAM.description: Yes: Criteria have been discussed and are attached to the Key Players.

a2d360000007FRcAAM.label: TAS15 - Political Alignment
a2d360000007FRcAAM.description: Yes: More Supporter/Mentor Key Players (with coverage) than Non-supporter/Enemy Key Players on the Relationship Map.

a2d360000007FRcAAM.label: TAS16 - Short Term Revenue
a2d360000007FRcAAM.description: Yes: The initial size of the opportunity is equal to or greater than the average opportunity size for your business.

a2d360000007FRcAAM.label: TAS17 - Future Revenue
a2d360000007FRcAAM.description: Yes: Future revenue is equal to or greater than the average lifetime value of a customer for your business.

a2d360000007FRcAAM.label: TAS18 - Profitability
a2d360000007FRcAAM.description: Yes: Profitability is equal to or greater than the average profit on an opportunity for your business.

a2d360000007FRcAAM.label: TAS19 - Degree Of Risk
a2d360000007FRcAAM.description: Yes: The customer is likely to succeed.

a2d360000007FRcAAM.label: TAS20 - Strategic Value
a2d360000007FRcAAM.description: Yes: This customer will have a greater-than-normal positive strategic impact on the company.

a2d360000007FRcAAM.label: Test & Improve Status
a2d360000007FRcAAM.description: Scheduled: T&I schedule date is today or in the future. Overdue: T&I schedule date is in the past. None: No open T&I scheduled.

a2d360000007FRcAAM.label: Insight Map Goals and Initiatives Owners
a2d360000007FRcAAM.description:
None (no owners on any goals or initiatives)
General (some owners, none are Key Players)
Some Key Players (some Key Player owners)
All Key Players (all goals and initiatives owned by Key Players)

a2d360000007FRcAAM.label: Insight Map Owner Awareness
a2d360000007FRcAAM.description: All if all Insight Map owners are on the Relationship Map. Some if some Insight Map owners are on the Relationship Map.

a2d360000007FRcAAM.label: Key Player Count
a2d360000007FRcAAM.description: Count of Key Players on the Relationship Map

a2d360000007FRcAAM.label: Decision Maker Count
a2d360000007FRcAAM.description: The number of Decision Makers on the Relationship Map

a2d360000007FRcAAM.label: Positive Contact Count
a2d360000007FRcAAM.description: Count of mentors and supporters on the political map.

a2d360000007FRcAAM.label: Negative Contact Count
a2d360000007FRcAAM.description: Count of non-supporters and enemy contacts on the political map.

a2d360000007FRcAAM.label: Days Since Last Modification
a2d360000007FRcAAM.description:
Days since the opportunity was last modified.  
Warning: this may not always be reliable as information *related* to the opportunity may be updated without being reflected here.

classes.processFilter: ownerid in (select AssigneeId from PermissionSetAssignment where PermissionSet.Name='Dealmaker_Max_User')
classes.name: Opportunities
classes.description: Guide your sales teams through every opportunity, sharing best practices and proven processes to progress their deals.
